SENT.plain: We report two patients aged 65 and 61 years, who presented a subacute dementia with normal CT scan without contrast injection
Angiography showed a dural arteriovenous malformation
The patients improved dramatically with treatment of the malformation
Dementia was characterised by frontal dysfunction, emotional disorders, amnesic and praxic impairment
This neuropsychological pattern suggests a profile of global dementia in the field of vascular dementia
